definition: 100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
to fit/suitable/proper/just (now)/comfortable/well/to go/to follow or pursue

sentences.english: Compared with utterance understanding, pragmatic presupposition has the basic features of appropriateness and common acceptance.
sentences.chinese: 相对于话语理解，语用预设具备合适性和共知性。

sentences.english: At appropriate places, he introduces the criticisms of the creationists and provides answers.
sentences.chinese: 在合适的地方他引进了对神创论的评判并提供解答。

sentences.english: Leverage symmetry of message flow, where appropriate.
sentences.chinese: 在合适的地方利用消息流的对称性。

sentences.english: The dress fits you just right.
sentences.chinese: 这件连衣裙你穿正合适。

sentences.english: Make sure your message is appropriate for each individual.
sentences.chinese: 确保你写给每个人的祝福语是合适的。

sentences.english: The magister has been kind enough to provide us with suitable gifts.
sentences.chinese: 总督已经很慷慨的为我们准备了合适的礼物了。

sentences.english: This is the hardest step, and requires appropriate tooling.
sentences.chinese: 这是最困难的一步，需要有合适的工具。

sentences.english: Stir in the cream and reheat to serving temperature without boiling.
sentences.chinese: 搅拌奶油，不用煮加热到合适的温度。

sentences.english: I anticipate the 17: 45 account is acceptable.
sentences.chinese: 我想那趟17点45分的航班很合适。

sentences.english: Is there a 'right' amount of money to leave to kids?
sentences.chinese: 你认为给孩子留多少钱才算合适？

sentences.english: Finding a thread for the nanoscopic needle to pull required more thinking.
sentences.chinese: 要给纳米碳管找到合适的线则需要更多的思考。

sentences.english: These clothes aren't really suited to a tropical climate.
sentences.chinese: 在热带气候区这种衣服实在不合适。

sentences.english: In my choice, the medical profession is the most suitable.
sentences.chinese: 依我的看法，从医最合适。

sentences.english: Have worked in large companies the technical backbone of the more appropriate.
sentences.chinese: 有在大公司担任过技术骨干的比较合适。

sentences.english: But any agreement must come with the right terms.
sentences.chinese: 但是任何协议必须要有合适的条款。

sentences.english: This wine goes very well with the steamed fish.

definition: best/(you) had better (do what we suggest)
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to try to find/to look for/to call on sb/to find/to seek/to return/to give change
